text: Achim Hill (April 1, 1935 - August 4, 2015) was a German rower. He competed for the Unified Team of Germany in the 1960 Summer Olympics and in the 1964 Summer Olympics and for East Germany in the 1968 Summer Olympics. He was born in KÃ¶penick. In 1960 he won the silver medal in the single sculls event. Four years later he won his second silver medal in the 1964 single sculls competition. At the 1968 Games he represented East Germany and finished fifth in the single sculls contest. ==Other websites== *Mention of Achim Hill's death Category:1935 births Category:2015 deaths Category:1968 Summer Olympics Category:German rowers Category:Olympic silver medalists for East Germany Category:Medalists at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Berlin
title: Achim Hill
